sentences.en: Followed by the elegiac address listened to his knees together, the oration by the ceremonial reading.
sentences.cn: 接着是一齐跪下听祭文, 祭文由礼生诵读.

sentences.en: He asks the private school gentleman of the village to keep an elegiac address for him.
sentences.cn: 他请村里的私塾先生替他写篇祭文.

sentences.en: He died at the end of this wistful and elegiac novel.
sentences.cn: 在这本情意绵绵的哀歌式小说的末尾,他结束了一生.

sentences.en: He recorded his emotion in elegiac lines of magnificent dignity.
sentences.cn: 他把他的感情宣泄在凄惋而庄严的诗句里.

sentences.en: He spoke of her in elegiac tones.
sentences.cn: 他以悲伤的口吻谈到了她。

sentences.en: Her poetry has an elegiac quality.
Ovid and Horace challenge comparison with the best elegiac and lyric poets of Greece.
sentences.cn: 奥维德和贺雷西要同希腊最好的挽歌和抒情诗人争一日之长.

sentences.en: The mourning hall is full of wreaths, and on all the walls elegiac scrolls are hung.
sentences.cn: 灵堂里摆满了花圈, 墙上也挂满了挽幛.

sentences.en: The music has a dreamy, elegiac quality.
sentences.cn: 那音乐有一种梦幻般的哀伤。

sentences.en: This is an abyss, between the sheets , pale white like an elegiac couplet.
sentences.cn: 这是深渊, 在枕褥之间,挽联般苍白.

words.tran_cn: 以挽歌哀悼，作挽歌祭吊

trans.tran_en: showing that you feel sad about someone who has died or something that no longer exists
